title:
Natarajasundaram Pillai, the nagaswaram
player who excelled in complex rhythms
description:
Pallavi Natarajasundaram Pillai, as he was known, was renowned for mallaris. The available recordings are an invaluable documentation of his style and a testimony to his astonishing grip on layam or thalam. There would be no dull moment in a concert by Natarajasundaram Pillai, says thavil  maestro 
Haridwaramangalam A.K. Palanivel

title: When Justice Party contemplated admitting Brahmins into its fold nearly 100 years ago
description: B. Munuswami Nayudu, the Chief Minister of Madras Presidency during 1930-32, tried in vain to admit ‘willing’ Brahmins to the party. At the party’s Nellore confederation in October 1929, he sought to amend the by-laws because the exclusion of one community had resulted in the party not being a ‘full representative’ of the Presidency

title: Remembering C. Minakshi, a trailblazing scholar and authority on Pallava history
description: She was the first woman to receive a doctorate from the University of Madras in 1936. In four years as a professional historian, she published over 30 articles and four books. In 1939, the ASI asked her to study the sculptures at the Vaikuntaperumal Temple in Kancheepuram. This work remains an authoritative reference on Pallava art

title: Morning Digest: Israeli Cabinet approves ‘outline’ of deal to release hostages held by Hamas; TVK tells Supreme Court ‘pre-planned conspiracy’ cannot be ruled out; and more

Shoe attack bid not a joke, an affront to institution, says judge on CJI bench
description: Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai stated he and Justice K. Vinod Chandran were shocked by a lawyer's shoe-throwing attempt on October 6, calling it a "forgotten chapter." The incident, which drew widespread condemnation, occurred while the CJI was hearing environmental clearance review pleas. Former Justice Markandey Katju, however, suggested the CJI's remarks about Lord Vishnu invited the incident.

title: Cough syrup toll at 23; Tamil Nadu pharma owner held
description: The death toll from adulterated cough syrup reached 23 after two more children died of renal failure. Police arrested the owner of Tamil Nadu-based Sresan Pharmaceuticals, which manufactured the contaminated Coldrif medicine. Investigations revealed the syrup was laced with DEG, an industrial solvent, leading to widespread seizures and a political blame game between state governments.

title: TNPCB report flags dangerously high levels of toxic metals in Manali waste incinerator ash
description: Cadmium levels ranged between 291.6 and 364.5 mg/kg, compared to the safe limit of 1.0 mg/kg, while lead levels were also extremely high

title: Record alert! Richa Ghosh creates history with highest-ever score at No 8
description: Richa Ghosh achieved a historic feat, scoring the highest-ever 94 by a batter at No. 8 or lower in Women's ODIs against South Africa. Her remarkable innings, featuring 11 fours and four sixes, propelled India to 251. Despite this individual brilliance, India faced a three-wicket defeat in a match that also saw both No. 8 batters score fifties.

title: School eye tests, ready reading glasses could give India ₹3.6 lakh crore every year: Study
description: This would also cover the equivalent of 9,60,000 extra years of schooling for students

title: In violence-hit Bahiyal, 178 ‘illegal commercial units’ demolished
Haryana youth feared killed fighting for Russia
description: A youth from Hisar, Sonu, is feared dead in the Russia-Ukraine war, with his companion Aman missing since September 22. Both men were reportedly deceived into joining the Russian army after going to Russia for a foreign language course. Families have sought help from the MHA and the Indian embassy in Moscow.

title: Holding areas, more staff and drones: Police, Railways devise crowd-control strategy for Surat, Udhna stations

description: The other findings show disparity between population size and allocation of resources

title: Follow the rules

'Didn't take responsibility': Harmanpreet Kaur rips top order after loss to South Africa
description: India's captain Harmanpreet Kaur expressed disappointment after the team's three-wicket loss to South Africa, citing the top order's failure to take responsibility. Despite Richa Ghosh's brilliant 94, South Africa's Nadine de Klerk and Laura Wolvaardt secured a memorable victory. Kaur praised Ghosh's performance, while de Klerk celebrated her Player of the Match award.

description: Home Minister Amit Shah has urged security forces to maintain 100% alert as winter approaches, warning of potential infiltration attempts by Pakistan and PoK-based terrorists exploiting snowfall. Reviewing the J&K security situation, Shah reiterated the government's commitment to a terrorism-free region, praising efforts to cripple terror networks and assuring continued support.

title: Grateful to BJP, says Mayawati; slams 'double-faced' SP
description: BSP chief Mayawati expressed gratitude to the UP BJP government for renovating the Kanshi Ram memorial, unlike the Samajwadi Party which allegedly hoarded ticket revenue. She highlighted the BJP government's responsiveness to her request to use memorial funds for its upkeep, contrasting it with the SP's inaction.

Strategic significance: Chenab hydel project set to get green clearance
description: India has greenlit the 1,856-MW Sawalkot hydroelectric project on the Chenab River in Jammu and Kashmir, a significant move following the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty. This run-of-the-river project, estimated at Rs 31,380 crore, aims to boost India's hydropower generation capacity and better utilize its share of western river waters.

title: Don't let extremists abuse freedoms: PM Modi to Starmer
description: Prime Minister Modi met with his UK counterpart Keir Starmer. They focused on strengthening the India-UK trade deal. Cooperation in the Indo-Pacific region was also a key discussion point. Technology, defence, and security partnerships were explored. PM Modi raised concerns about anti-India activities by Khalistan separatists. The need to act against economic fugitives within legal frameworks was also emphasized.

title: Ruling NC MLA brings private member’s Bill to restore pre-2019 Land Grants Act in J&K
description: He said the Bill also sought to protect lawful occupants from eviction, ensure transparent renewals, and prioritize land grants for residents, cooperatives and local entrepreneurs

description: Each count is punishable by up to 30 years in prison, but should Ms. James be convicted, any sentence would be determined by a judge

title: Supreme Court to ADR: Seems there is too much passion and little reason
description: The Supreme Court questioned the veracity of an NGO's affidavits alleging voter list deletions in Bihar, with the Election Commission pointing out falsehoods. While directing an inquiry into deletions, the court expressed skepticism about the NGO's claims due to unsubstantiated allegations and a perceived lack of reason.

title: Hope Supreme Court will consider people’s expectations on restoration of Statehood: J&K Deputy Chief Minister
description: The top court is likely to hear a petition on restoration of Statehood on Friday

title: India-US ties: Government will be cautious on trade talks, says official
description: Prime Minister Modi and President Trump discussed trade following Indian negotiators' return from Washington. Despite past experiences with the US administration, India hopes for a softened stance, though caution remains. Navigating Russian oil purchases is crucial for any potential trade deal.

description: Israeli Knesset Speaker Amir Ohana has invited former US President Donald Trump to address the parliament, calling him the "greatest friend and ally of the Jewish people." The invitation highlights Trump's role in brokering regional agreements and recognizing Jerusalem as Israel's capital. This marks a significant gesture of gratitude for his leadership and the US-Israel alliance.

title: Six Indian skeet shooters to compete at ISSF World Championship for Shotgun in Greece

title: India assured of historic medal at BWF World Junior Mixed Team Championships
description: The Indian shuttlers will face Asian U-19 mixed team champions Indonesia in the semifinals

title: India's purchase of Russian oil figures in talks, says UK PM Keir Starmer
description: UK PM Keir Starmer confirmed discussions with PM Modi regarding India's purchase of Russian oil amidst the Ukraine conflict. Starmer highlighted the 'coalition of the willing's' efforts, including measures against Russia's 'shadow fleet,' aimed at ending the war. He also praised a peace deal on Gaza as a significant breakthrough.

title: Charlie Kirk’s All-American Halftime draws fans, challenges Bad Bunny
description: Turning Point USA is launching a counter-Super Bowl halftime show, 'The All-American Halftime Show,' to rival Bad Bunny's performance. Promising a 'faith, family, and freedom' theme, the event includes a survey asking for music genres, notably offering 'Anything in English.' This move sparks debate over cultural inclusivity versus 'all-American' values, turning the halftime spectacle into a political and cultural battleground.

title: PM Modi, Keir Starmer condemn terror in all its forms and manifestations
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and UK counterpart Keir Starmer strongly condemned terrorism, including the Pahalgam attack, and pledged zero tolerance. They agreed to counter radicalisation, combat terror financing, and prevent the exploitation of new technologies for terrorist purposes. Both leaders also expressed support for peace in Ukraine.

title: In meet with Keir Starmer, PM Modi stresses need to move against economic fugitives
description: Prime Minister Modi and UK counterpart Keir Starmer met to bolster bilateral ties, focusing on defense cooperation, including military training and missile systems. Both leaders committed to enhancing collaboration in the Indo-Pacific and promoting multilateralism, with the UK reiterating support for India's UNSC aspirations. Discussions also covered economic trade, technology partnerships, and critical minerals.

title: De Klerk’s knock leaves India stunned
description: The all-rounder’s 54-ball 84, along with skipper Wolvaardt and Tryon’s efforts, takes South Africa home after it wobbles in the chase; batting first, Harmanpreet’s side collapses like a pack of cards before Richa’s sensational innings and her 88-run partnership with Sneh steer the team to 251

title: Expenses, income gap huge in farm sector: All India Kisan Sabha
description: AIKS leaders blame the Centre not implementing the C2+50% M.S. Swaminathan commission formula; Minister refutes charges, says MSP is decided after consultations with farm outfits

title: Will Trump attend hostage release event? US President to travel to Middle East Sunday
I-T dept flags unreported cash property deals in Bihar and UP, asks sub-registrars to act
description: The Income Tax Department is investigating cash transactions exceeding Rs 2 lakh in property deals, particularly in Bihar and Uttar Pradesh districts bordering Nepal. Sub-registrars in these areas have been found to be misreporting and failing to share crucial data, including transactions over Rs 30 lakh and PAN details, prompting the department to seek state government intervention.

title: Glaring discrepancy in TCS’s people number raises serious concerns about transparency: Labour Union
description: TCS reported a closing headcount of 5,93,314 employees in Q2 FY26, compared to 6,13,069 employees in Q1 FY26

title: NTPC Green Energy signs MoU with Gujarat govt to develop 10 GW solar, 5 GW wind capacity
description: NTPC as an entity aspires to attain 60 GW of renewable capacity by 2032

title: Taylor Swift reportedly distances from Blake Lively amid Justin Baldoni legal drama
description: Pop star Taylor Swift and actress Blake Lively are reportedly reconnecting after a year of silence. Sources reveal Swift has made it clear she will not publicly endorse Lively or support her in ongoing legal matters. Apologies have been exchanged regarding Lively's involvement in a lawsuit. Swift's stance indicates a desire to remain uninvolved in the case.

title: Hope amid despair
‘Need very badly’: Trump announces Arctic cutters deal with Finland
description: America is set to acquire 11 icebreaking vessels from Finland, a significant move to boost its Arctic presence. President Trump announced the deal, emphasizing Finland's expertise in building these crucial ships. This collaboration will see four vessels constructed in Finland and seven in the US, strengthening bilateral defense ties amidst rising Arctic importance.

Maria Sharapova & Alexander Gilkes: Dating, engagement, and parenthood timeline
description: Tennis star Maria Sharapova and businessman Alexander Gilkes began dating in 2018. They got engaged in 2020 and welcomed their son Theodore in 2022. The couple prioritizes family and has not rushed wedding plans. They are set to celebrate Maria's International Tennis Hall of Fame induction in 2025, showcasing their enduring bond.

title: Tejashwi Yadav’s big poll pledge: A government job for every household
description: Tejashwi Prasad Yadav, RJD leader and INDIA bloc chairman, has pledged a government job for every household in Bihar. He promises to introduce the legislation within 20 days of forming the government and ensure its implementation within 20 months. This move aims to address the significant unemployment issue in the state.

description: Communicating the clever thinking of scientists who win these prizes is a rewarding exercise. But lately, it has also become embarrassing

description: Raid was conducted on a prominent coaching centre of Bhubaneswar to ascertain any possible link between the coaching centre, job seekers, and the scamsters

title: Ayesha Curry’s 'no male attention' comments resurface, spark online backlash
description: Ayesha Curry's past comments about lacking male attention and her initial disinterest in marriage and children have resurfaced, sparking significant fan outrage. These remarks, made on "Red Table Talk" and the "Call Her Daddy" podcast, have led to widespread criticism and calls for Stephen Curry to address the controversy publicly.

title: Karnataka approves 12 menstrual leaves a year across sectors
description: Karnataka has approved a groundbreaking policy offering one paid menstrual leave monthly to women across all employment sectors, benefiting over 50 lakh individuals. This move, championed by CM Siddaramaiah, aims to foster a more understanding workplace. The state joins Bihar and Odisha in this initiative, with the Karnataka Menstrual Leave and Hygiene Bill, 2025, proposing 12 days annually for working women.

title: Welder hacked to death in Vellore
In talk with Donald Trump, PM Modi hails success of Gaza peace plan
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated US President Donald Trump on the "historic" Gaza peace plan and discussed "good progress" in trade negotiations. The leaders agreed to stay in close touch, hinting at a potential meeting. Modi also joined UK PM Keir Starmer in supporting the US peace plan, emphasizing a lasting and just peace with a Two-State solution.

This initiative aims to reduce costs and improve efficiency across government operations.

Police have registered a case and are searching for the accused.

Siblings who moved to bus rear seat to play survive Himachal Pradesh landslide tragedy
description: A devastating landslide in Bilaspur tragically claimed 16 lives, but two young siblings, Aarushi and Shaurya, miraculously survived. They were playing at the rear of the bus when the landslide struck the front, with the seats shielding them from the crushing debris. The children, who lost their mother, aunt, and cousins, were rescued alive amidst the horrific scene, a testament to sheer luck and resilience.

title: Jagan announces ₹5 lakh ex gratia for Kurupam victims kin
Mere use of abusive, defamatory or filthy language not offence: HC
description: The Bombay High Court ruled that using abusive or defamatory language alone does not constitute an offense under Section 294 of the IPC. The court emphasized that both obscenity and public annoyance must be proven with evidence. In a specific case, the court quashed charges under this section as no one was shown to be annoyed or the language deemed obscene.

title: Women’s World Cup: Nadine de Klerk wins the battle of No 8s, helping South Africa go past India in a stiff chase

How Richa Ghosh counterpunched India to a competitive total vs South Africa in ICC Women’s World Cup
‘LPG cylinder’ blast kills 5, razes 2-storey house in Ayodhya village
description: A massive explosion in Ayodhya's Pagla Bhari village destroyed a two-storey house, killing five people, including the owner and his two children. The blast, reportedly triggered by an LPG cylinder, scattered debris over a wide radius. Investigations are underway to determine the exact cause, with preliminary reports ruling out firecrackers.

description: India and Australia have deepened their defence cooperation. Three key pacts were signed to enhance information sharing and military interoperability. Both nations are committed to a free and open Indo-Pacific. This collaboration comes as regional security concerns grow. The agreements aim to bolster maritime security and strategic partnerships.

description: Despite a recent loss to the Denver Broncos, the Philadelphia Eagles, Super Bowl LIX champions, are set to face the New York Giants. Star running back Saquon Barkley, who had a sore knee after the last game, has recovered and will play against his former team. Barkley expressed his understanding of football's challenges and the importance of enjoying the process.

‘I love Muhammad’ row fallout: Raza gets recovery notice in 28-yr-old Rs 5k loan case
description: Bareilly administration has reopened a 30-year-old loan default case against cleric Maulana Tauqeer Raza. He owes Rs 5,560 from 1990, now Rs 28,386 with interest. This action follows his arrest after recent violence. Authorities are also reviewing other financial and administrative irregularities linked to Raza's network. Demolitions and sealing of premises have occurred. This is part of a wider crackdown on alleged financial and administrative irregularities.

description: Married women across North India observe Karwa Chauth, fasting from sunrise to moonrise for their husbands' well-being. This tradition, rooted in love and devotion, sees women dressing vibrantly and participating in prayer ceremonies. Modern couples increasingly fast together, reflecting evolving marital respect and equality. The festival culminates with moon sighting and breaking the fast.

China to India: 'Promise' that rare earth magnets supplied will not be re-exported to US
description: China has tightened rare earth export controls, restricting processing technology and targeting defense and semiconductor users. Beijing is reportedly seeking guarantees from India that its heavy rare earth magnets will not be re-exported to the US, aiming to use these controls as a bargaining chip in trade talks.

title: Google changes work policy: ‘Work From Anywhere’ can’t be used for WFH; sends memo
description: Google is reportedly tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, intended to prevent WFA from substituting regular hybrid work, has drawn criticism from employees for its confusing implementation and restrictions.

title: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu sends ‘Thank You’ message to Amit Shah; dedicates it to engineers
description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has switched to Zoho Mail, India's homegrown email platform, a move celebrated by Zoho co-founder Sridhar Vembu. This decision aligns with the government's push for digital sovereignty and boosts the adoption of Indian tech solutions. Shah's endorsement signifies a growing confidence in the nation's indigenous digital infrastructure.

title: Gisele Bündchen’s former Manhattan townhouse lists for $17M after 20 years
description: Gisele Bundchen's former New York City home is now for sale. The elegant townhouse in Manhattan's West Village is listed at $16.995 million. Bundchen owned the property about 20 years ago. The historic home offers refined living space and modern amenities. This property represents a piece of supermodel history in a sought-after neighborhood.

title: Brittany Mahomes stuns in Abercrombie NFL collection; Randi cheers
description: Brittany Mahomes has launched a stylish new NFL apparel line with Abercrombie & Fitch, showcasing custom Kansas City Chiefs outfits. The collaboration, shot at Arrowhead Stadium, highlights her entrepreneurial spirit and family pride, earning praise from fans and mother-in-law Randi Mahomes. This venture comes as the Chiefs navigate a challenging season, with Brittany encouraging fans to support the team.
